level.heading: CERTIFYING ENTITY (§ 14-2214) A Household shall obtain, and an Owner shall accept, a Certification of Income,ffordability, and Housing Size only from a Certifying Entity approved by theepartment of Housing and Community Development. The Department of Housing and Community Development may approve a Certifyingntity pursuant to a request for proposals process or through an applicationrocess. The Department of Housing and Community Development shall approve a Certifyingntity based on the entity’s experience in successfully implementingctivities similar to those described in § 2214.4, the capacity and experiencef the entity’s staff and management, the capacity and support of thentity’s board of directors, the strength of the entity’s financial andanagement systems, and any other factors the Department of Housing andommunity Development deems relevant. A Certifying Entity shall be responsible for certification of a Household’snnual Income, certification of a Household’s household size, certificationhat the rent or purchase price of an Inclusionary Unit is affordable to theousehold, counseling and training Households for homeownership, reporting datao the Department of Housing and Community Development, compliance with relevantegulations, and any other activities required by the Department of Housing andommunity Development.
